title: iMac 27 2013 No Power
message:
Got a 27inch Imac in today which has no power. Customer says it was working fine until it was knocked off the table (screen is broken also but that's a separate issue)

I've opened it up and appear to have 12V coming out of the PSU to the motherboard and LED1 for standby power is on. When I press the power button nothing happens at all  - i've checked the power button for continuity when it's pressed and it appears to be working. 

I'm leaning towards maybe a PSU fault but I don't see many of these issues so would appreciate any guidance as to where I should check first as I would have to order a new PSU!

title: iMac 27 2013 No Power
message:
First of all, post 820-xxxx code of your board.
Next, tell us which schematic/boardview use as guide, if original not available...

title: iMac 27 2013 No Power
message: After much searching on the board I found it - 820-3478

title: iMac 27 2013 No Power
message:
Check if 5V_S4 tries to appear at L7650, when you press power button.
If nothing, check for pulse at pin 24/U7600.
ISL62383C fails too much in these machines...

title: iMac 27 2013 No Power
message: I shall check those thanks! Is there any easy way of testing the PSU's on these or is it a case of if it makes 12V it's probably fine?

title: iMac 27 2013 No Power
message: If you get stable 12V, PSU is OK.
